channel.title: Stats menu...? For admins
channel.description:
Admins and mods on my server cant see the stat menu when right clicking on them...
I tried to make it so when you put ::stats (username) then the statmenu page would come up.
But it doesnt work, so I was wondering if anyone knows how to do this...
Thanks

erm idk, I’m to tired to make something now… but to have admins etc rightclick and get stats do what i just posted lol

item.title: Stats menu...? For admins
item.dc:creator: @mr_candy mr candy
item.description:
@mr_candy wrote:

ahh i havent done this for like 2-3 months but i slightly remember what you need to do open your client.java search for “stat” there around that block of code look for 3 lines that are virtually identical the diference is 2 of them are crap it should have somthing like ifplayerrights=2 or 3 alls you do is delete the two shit ones

NOTE:i havent fucked with private servers for over 3 months so taking my advise would be clever but and thats a big butt make a back up i dont want you crying because you forgotten how to fix a error

Read full topic

item.title: Stats menu...? For admins
item.dc:creator: @wooker wooker
item.description:
@wooker wrote:

Search for “stats” and you’ll have somethin like thisif(playerRights == 0) { outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(5); // command slot (does it matter which one?) outStream.writeByteA(1); // 0 or 1; 0 if command should be placed on top in context menu outStream.writeString("Stats"); outStream.endFrameVarSize(); } else if(playerRights > 0) { outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(5); // command slot (does it matter which one?) outStream.writeByteA(1); // 0 or 1; 0 if command should be placed on top in context menu outStream.writeString("Kick"); outStream.endFrameVarSize(); }replace it all with this outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(5); // command slot (does it matter which one?) outStream.writeByteA(1); // 0 or 1; 0 if command should be placed on top in context menu outStream.writeString("Stats"); outStream.endFrameVarSize(); That should work.

Read full topic
